l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons Validator
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Commons Validator provides the building blocks for both client side validation and server side data validation. It may be used standalone or with a framework like Struts.

l:dependency.name: Commons Digester
l:dependency.l:description: The Digester package lets you configure an XML to Java object mapping module which triggers certain actions called rules whenever a particular pattern of nested XML elements is recognized.

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons BeanUtils
l:dependency.l:description: Apache Commons BeanUtils provides an easy-to-use but flexible wrapper around reflection and introspection.

l:dependency.l:description: Jersey is the open source (under dual CDDL+GPL license) JAX-RS (JSR 311) production quality Reference Implementation for building RESTful Web services.

l:dependency.name: Commons Lang
l:dependency.l:description: Commons Lang, a package of Java utility classes for the classes that are in java.lang's hierarchy, or are considered to be so standard as to justify existence in java.lang.

l:dependency.name: jersey-client
l:dependency.l:description: Jersey is the open source (under dual CDDL+GPL license) JAX-RS (JSR 311) production quality Reference Implementation for building RESTful Web services.

l:dependency.name: jersey-bundle
l:dependency.l:description: A bundle containing code of all jar-based modules that provide JAX-RS and Jersey-related features. Such a bundle is *only intended* for developers that do not use Maven's dependency system. The bundle does not include code for contributes, tests and samples.

l:dependency.name: Commons Discovery

l:dependency.name: JavaBeans Activation Framework (JAF)
l:dependency.l:description: JavaBeans Activation Framework (JAF) is a standard extension to the Java platform that lets you take advantage of standard services to: determine the type of an arbitrary piece of data; encapsulate access to it; discover the operations available on it; and instantiate the appropriate bean to perform the operation(s).

l:license.name: Common Development and Distribution License (CDDL) v1.0

l:dependency.name: axis
l:dependency.l:description: POM was created from deploy:deploy-file

l:dependency.name: ROME, RSS and atOM utilitiEs for Java
l:dependency.l:description: All Roads Lead to ROME. ROME is a set of Atom/RSS Java utilities that make it easy to work in Java with most syndication formats. Today it accepts all flavors of RSS (0.90, 0.91, 0.92, 0.93, 0.94, 1.0 and 2.0), Atom 0.3 and Atom 1.0 feeds. Rome includes a set of parsers and generators for the various flavors of feeds, as well as converters to convert from one format to another. The parsers can give you back Java objects that are either specific for the format you want to work with, or a generic normalized SyndFeed object that lets you work on with the data without bothering about the underlying format.
